meanings.sent1: The priest rebaptized the man who wanted to reaffirm his faith.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rebaptize herself after a period of doubt.
meanings.sent3: The fish in the pond joked that they should rebaptize each other for fun.
meanings.sent4: The garden was rebaptized with a new name to attract more visitors.
meanings.sent5: The old building was rebaptized as a community center, bringing new life to the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Administer the sacrament of baptism to someone again
meanings.sent1: The pastor rebaptized the woman who had converted to a different faith.
meanings.sent2: In some religions, individuals may choose to be rebaptized as a symbol of renewal.
meanings.sent3: The cat jokingly suggested that the dog should be rebaptized with a new name.
meanings.sent4: The city was rebaptized with a grand ceremony to mark its historical significance.
meanings.sent5: The tree was rebaptized with a new plaque to honor its age and beauty.
